H0.text: what type of government system does italy have. Federal Republic

H1.text: what type of government system does italy have. Parliamentary Democracy

H2.text: what type of government system does italy have. Constitutional Monarchy

H3.text: what type of government system does italy have. Unitary state

A4.text: The Republic is composed of the Municipalities, Provinces, Metropolitan Cities, the Regions and the State. Municipalities, provinces, metropolitan cities and regions are recognised as autonomous entities having their own statutes, powers and functions in accordance with the principles of Constitution.

A5.text: The allocation of legislative powers between the State and the Regions is established in compliance with the Constitution and with the constraints deriving from international treaties, besides the already mentioned autonomous status granted to some Regions.
